panel.title: ILS Automation Installer for APCW Ignition Applications
panel.preamble: Welcome to the ILS Automation installer for Advanced Process Control Workbench (APCW). The table below compares the existing installation of this product on this system, if any, with the versions contained in this new installation. Before continuing, please make sure that you have defined tag providers and database connections for both production and isolation-mode (test) environments as appropriate.

panel.title: End User License Agreement (EULA)
panel.preamble: Click on the button below to view the license that specifies permissible use of the software to be installed. Select the checkbox to indicate acceptance of the terms. You must accept the license terms before proceeding.

panel.title: Project Selection
Common interface Definitions
panel.preamble: Specify tag provider and database connections as used by various Ignition Applications. Both production and test mode versions of provider and database must be specified. The selections here are used by subsequent screens.

panel.title: Custom Icons for Ignition Applications
panel.preamble: Custom icons are used extensively when drawing blocks in the Block Language Toolkit. They may also be found in many of the user screens.

panel.title: Python Code for Ignition Applications
panel.preamble: This page loads Python code that supports the Ignition Application suite. The Python is divided into two categories: code developed by ILS Automation that is generic and used in multiple products, and code specific to the current XOM applications. A third category consists of Java jar files that are referenced by the Python.

panel.title: Install Diagnostic Toolkit Module
panel.preamble: This step installs the Diagnostic Toolkit module. IMPORTANT: If this is the first time that you have installed this module on your system, it will be placed in quarantine mode. To complete the installation, you will have to navigate to the Modules page and select the install option next to the module.

panel.title: Install SFC Extension Module
panel.preamble: This step installs the SFC Extension module. IMPORTANT: If this is the first time that you have installed this module, it will be placed in quarantine mode. To complete the installation, you will have to navigate to the Modules page and select the install option next to the module.

panel.preamble: This page defines UDTs and tags that are needed by the applications when running in PRODUCTION mode. NOTE: The import does not remove existing tags that differ from tag resources in the installer.

panel.title: Main Project
panel.preamble: XOM is the main Ignition project. This page provides artifacts for a clean, new installation or, alternatively, a merge with an existing version. A merge preserves any user modifications from a previous version.

panel.title: Alarm Pipeline and SFCs
panel.preamble: This page handles installation of Alarm Pipelines, shared Python and Sequential Function Charts. These are packaged as an Ignition global project and completely replace any existing pipelines or charts of the same name.

panel.title: Install the DbManager Project
panel.preamble: DbManager is a utility for maintenance of application databases. It is not generally user-customizable. The action on this page completely replaces any existing copy.

panel.title: Test Framework Module
panel.preamble: This step installs the test framework module. The test framework is optional and should not be used on a production system. When used on a hybrid Production / Development system then great caution must be used to insure that test data does not leak to the production FCS.

epilog.title: Ignition Applications - Installed
epilog.preamble: Now that all of the automated installation and configuration of the APCW Application is complete, there are just a few more manual steps required.
epilog.note: If this is the first time that a particular module has been installed, then it will be in a quarantined state at the end of the installation. Navigate to the "Module" screen on the Gateway page. Select the "install" option next to the listing of each quarantined module.
Several modules with active components have been installed. A Gateway restart is required.
Newly created projects are disabled when they are installed. They must be enabled before use. Restart the Gateway, then edit each project setting it to "enabled".
